revised_title: The Antiquity of Venereal Disease: A Response to Objections
tldr: In this letter, William Beckett defends his theory that the venereal disease and leprosy are two distinct illnesses. He argues that the symptoms and modes of transmission of the two diseases differ significantly, and that the treatment methods used for each disease also vary. Beckett cites historical evidence to support his claims, emphasizing the differences between the two diseases and their effects on the human body.
